snippet: With the flow of oil and border security at risk, the longstanding rivals discussed joint patrols of South Sudan’s oil fields, among other measures.
abstract: South Sudan and Sudan are discussing joint patrols in the South's oil-producing states, discussion that would have seemed unthinkable just a few years ago; while the conflict in South Sudan has drawn the attention of the world, nowhere are leaders watching the crisis with more interest than in Sudan.

byline.original: By ISMA'IL KUSHKUSH and NICHOLAS KULISH
byline.contributor: Isma’il Kushkush reported from Khartoum, and Nicholas Kulish from Nairobi, Kenya.

lead_paragraph: With the flow of oil and border security at risk, the longstanding rivals discussed joint patrols of South Sudan’s oil fields, among other measures.

headline.main: High Stakes for Sudan in the South’s Conflict
headline.print_headline: High Stakes for Sudan in the South’s Conflict

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
